intro: Chaenorhinum serpyllifolium, commonly known as the common whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender stems with opposite, narrow, and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
